Package authentication

Class Client

java.lang.Object
authentication.Client
public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
This class handles the all the communication with the server, except the Lobby and Game, using a Socket and ObjectOutputStream and ObjectInputStream.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Client​(java.lang.String serverIP)
    Creates a unconnected client.

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client​(java.lang.String serverIP)
      Creates a unconnected client.
      Parameters:
      serverIP - The IP address of the server.

  • Method Details

    • startRunning

      public void startRunning()
      Makes the connection to the server, sends it the data present in accountInfo and stores server response in the appropriate field according to the "type" of the message. Finally, closes the connection.

      To get the response, call the corresponding method depending on the "type":

      Type Method to get response
      Register: isValidated
      Login: isInfoCorrect
      Host: getPortNumber
      AddFriend: isFriendAdded WARNING: For internal use only. Use askFriendship for the intended result
      RemoveFriend: isFriendRemoved
      ChangePassword: isPasswordChanged
      DeleteAccount: isAccountDeleted
      FriendsList: getFriends
      askFriendship: -
      Comms: (Sends response directly to communicator object set in setCommunicationWith(MainLogic))
      See Also:
      sendInformation(String[] accountInfo), setCommunicationWith(MainLogic)

    • sendInformation

      public void sendInformation​(java.lang.String[] accountInfo)
      Saves the specified accountInfo message and sends it to the server by calling startRunning().

      The first string in accountInfo determines the "type" of the message. What the contents of the String array represent for each "type" is displayed in the list below:

      • {Register, (username), (password), (email)}
      • {Login, (username), (password)}
      • {Logout, (username)}
      • {RemoveFriend, (username), (username of friend to remove)}
      • {AddFriend, (username), (username of person to add)}
      • {ChangePassword, (username), (new password)}
      • {DeleteAccount, (username)}
      • {Host, (username)}
      • {FriendsList, (username)}
      • {askFriendship, (username), (username of person to ask)}
      • {Comms, (username)}
      Parameters:
      accountInfo - the String array to send.
      See Also:
      startRunning()

    • getFriends

      public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getFriends()
      Returns a list of friends of this client stored in the database.
      Returns:
      a List<String> of friends of this client.

    • isValidated

      public int isValidated()
      Returns a value that represents the result of the registration attempt.
      Returns:
      1 if register completed,

      0 if username was already taken,

      -1 if there was an error connecting with the database.

    • isInfoCorrect

      public int isInfoCorrect()
      Returs a value that represents the result of the login attempt.
      Returns:
      1 if login succesfull,

      0 if username is not in the database,

      -1 if the password is wrong or there was an error connecting with the database,

      2 if this username is already logged in.

    • isFriendAdded

      public int isFriendAdded()
      Returns a value that represents the result of the attempt to add a friend.
      Returns:
      1 if friend was added,

      0 if the username of the friend to add is NOT in the database,

      -1 if there was an error connecting with the database,

      2 if the friend is already in the friend list of this user.

    • isFriendRemoved

      public int isFriendRemoved()
      Returns a value that represents the result of the attempt to remove a friend.
      Returns:
      1 if friend was removed,

      0 if the user you are trying to unfriend is not listed as your friend in the database,

      -1 if there was an error connecting with the database.

    • isPasswordChanged

      public int isPasswordChanged()
      Returns a value that represents the result of the attempt to change the the account's password.
      Returns:
      1 if password was changed succesfully,

      -1 if there was an error connecting with the database.

    • isAccountDeleted

      public int isAccountDeleted()
      Returns a value that represents the result of the attempt to delete the user's account.
      Returns:
      1 if account was deleted from database succesfully,

      -1 if there was an error connecting with the database.

    • getPort_number

      public int getPort_number()
      Returns the port number to be used to connect to the game lobby.
      Returns:
      the port number in which the server hosts the lobby.

    • setCommunicationWith

      public void setCommunicationWith​(MainLogic communicator)
      Sets the communicator to where the responses from the server with "type" Comms will be directly sent to.

      Messages of this "type", unlike all the other types, will not close the connection between client and server after being received until the message received is "END".

      Parameters:
      communicator - Object which will be used to receive communications of "type" Comms.
